entries.title: Ballers
entries.synopsis: Success hits hard. Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson stars in this series as a retired football superstar trying to reinvent himself as a financial manager for current players in sun-soaked Miami.

entries.title: Barry
entries.synopsis: Watch HBO's new series Barry, Sundays at 10:30pm ET. Bill Hader stars in this dark comedy as a hitman from the Midwest who takes up acting while on assignment in LA. Find full episodes, interviews, episode guides and more.

entries.title: Big Little Lies
entries.synopsis: Based on Liane Moriarty's bestselling book, this darkly comedic series tells the tale of three mothers (Reese Witherspoon, Nicole Kidman, Shailene Woodley) whose seemingly perfect lives unravel to the point of murder.

entries.title: Big Love
entries.synopsis: Bill Paxton stars as Bill Henrickson, a polygamist who faces a myriad of challenges in meeting the emotional, romantic and financial needs of his three wives and seven children in suburban Salt Lake City.

entries.title: Boardwalk Empire
entries.synopsis: Follow the birth and rise of organized crime in "the world's playground" at the dawn of Prohibition. Steve Buscemi stars as Enoch "Nucky" Thompson — the man in charge of Atlantic City in 1920. Created by Terence Winter and produced by Martin Scorsese, Stephen Levinson and more.

entries.title: Bored to Death
entries.synopsis: Jason Schwartzman plays noir-fiction-obsessed writer — and unlicensed private eye — Jonathan Ames, who impulsively lists his gumshoe services on Craigslist.

entries.title: The Brink
entries.synopsis: When a rogue general seizes control of Pakistan and its nuclear arsenal, the fate of the world is left on the shoulders of three unlikely American heroes in this comedy starring Tim Robbins, Jack Black and Pablo Schreiber.

entries.title: The Comeback
entries.synopsis: Ten years ago she was TV's "It" girl. Now desperate to revive her career, actress Valerie Cherish (Lisa Kudrow) agrees to star in a reality show that follows her efforts to land a part in a new sitcom.

entries.title: Crashing
entries.synopsis: Pete Holmes stars in his own comedy series about a stand-up comic who reevaluates his life and enters the New York comedy scene after discovering his wife's infidelity.

entries.title: Curb Your Enthusiasm
entries.synopsis: Larry David stars as Larry David, living the good life out in Los Angeles and stumbling through one faux-pas after another.

entries.title: Deadwood
entries.synopsis: Set in 1876, when the richest gold strike in U.S. history drew a throng of restless misfits to an outlaw settlement in the Black Hills of South Dakota, Deadwood features a cast of surly inhabitants led by actors Timothy Olyphant and Ian McShane.

entries.title: The Defiant Ones
entries.synopsis: This four-part docu-series explores the unlikely but ultimately unbreakable bond between Jimmy Iovine and Dr. Dre.

entries.title: Divorce
entries.synopsis: Sarah Jessica Parker and Thomas Haden Church star in this biting comedy series from creator Sharon Horgan about the lows and lower lows of a very long divorce.

entries.title: Eastbound & Down
entries.synopsis: Danny McBride stars as former pitcher and baseball star, Kenny Powers, who finds himself out of baseball — and reduced to teaching Phys Ed at his old middle school.

entries.title: Enlightened
entries.synopsis: Laura Dern stars as Amy Jellicoe, a self-destructive corporate buyer with a new perspective about the merits of self-help and inner healing. Diane Ladd (Dern's real life mom) and Luke Wilson also star along with creator Mike White.

entries.title: Entourage
entries.synopsis: Adrian Grenier plays Hollywood up-and-comer Vincent Chase, whose agent, brother, and friends help him navigate the ins and outs of film-stardom. Also features Jeremy Piven, Kevin Dillon, Kevin Connolly and Jerry Ferrara.

entries.title: Family Tree
entries.synopsis: A man with few roots, little family, and no sense of his purpose in life inherits a mysterious box of belongings that sends him on an all-consuming investigation into his lineage. From Christopher Guest (Best in Show, A Mighty Wind) and starring Chris O'Dowd.

entries.title: Game of Thrones
entries.synopsis: Summers span decades. Winters can last a lifetime. And the struggle for the Iron Throne begins. Based on the bestselling book series by George R.R. Martin and created by David Benioff and D.B. Weiss.

entries.title: Generation Kill
entries.synopsis: From creators Ed Burns and David Simon (The Wire), this seven-part miniseries focuses on the first 40 days of the war in Iraq, as told by an elite group of U.S. Marines.

entries.title: Getting On
entries.synopsis: From the creators of Big Love comes this dark, biting workplace comedy that follows the beleaguered staffers of an equally beleaguered hospital's geriatric wing.

entries.title: Hello Ladies
entries.synopsis: Stephen Merchant stars as Stuart, a web designer who's half as charming as he thinks he is, and twice as desperate.

entries.title: How to Make It in America
entries.synopsis: Bryan Greenberg and Victor Rasuk star as aspiring designers living in New York City, plotting to achieve the American Dream on their own terms.

entries.title: Hung
entries.synopsis: Thomas Jane stars as an underpaid high school teacher who hatches a plan to make the most of his plus-sized package.

entries.title: In Treatment
entries.synopsis: Therapist Dr. Paul Weston (Gabriel Byrne) exhibits an insightful, reserved demeanor while treating his patients, but succumbs to crippling insecurity with his own therapist in this half-hour drama series.

entries.title: Insecure
entries.synopsis: Creator Issa Rae (The Misadventures of Awkward Black Girl) stars as Issa Dee, who struggles to navigate the tricky professional and personal terrain of Los Angeles along with her best friend Molly (Yvonne Orji).

entries.title: John Adams
entries.synopsis: Paul Giamatti plays America’s least understood and most underestimated Founding Father in this Emmy-winning miniseries about the second President of the United States.

entries.title: Jonah From Tonga
entries.synopsis: Notorious troublemaker Jonah Takalua of Summer Heights High returns in this six-part comedy series from creator, writer and star Chris Lilley.

entries.title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver
entries.synopsis: Breaking news on a weekly basis. John Oliver hosts this half-hour comedy that takes a satirical look at the week in news, politics and current events.

entries.title: Life's Too Short
entries.synopsis: Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant star alongside Warwick Davis, who plays a self-aggrandizing version of himself as he desperately tries to hustle his way back into the spotlight as Britain's go-to little person.

entries.title: Little Britain USA
entries.synopsis: Two men, dozens of outrageous characters. Matt Lucas and David Walliams blend of scripted comedy and characterization in the American installment of their hit British series.

entries.title: Looking
entries.synopsis: Three thirtysomething friends living in San Francisco explore the exciting, sometimes overwhelming, options available to a new generation of gay men.

entries.title: Luck
entries.synopsis: Set in the worlds of horseracing and gambling, Luck stars Dustin Hoffman as "Ace" Bernstein, who crafts a complex plan to reverse the sagging fortunes of a California racetrack.

entries.title: Mildred Pierce
entries.synopsis: Kate Winslet, Guy Pearce and Evan Rachel Wood star in James M. Cain's novel adaptation about a divorcee who risks losing everything amidst Depression-era California by building a business empire.

entries.title: Olive Kitteridge
entries.synopsis: There's no such thing as a simple life. Frances McDormand, Richard Jenkins and Bill Murray star in this four-part miniseries about a woman, her family and the small, quiet town in which they live — abound with crime, illicit affairs and unexpected tragedy.

entries.title: Oz
entries.synopsis: At Oswald Maximum Security Penitentiary, inmates are considered lucky if they get into the prison's "Emerald City" unit. They're even luckier if they get out alive.

entries.title: Parade's End
entries.synopsis: Benedict Cumberbatch and Rebecca Hall lead this five-part World War I drama about an English aristocrat, his socialite wife and his torrid affair with a young suffragette.

entries.title: Project Greenlight
entries.synopsis: A new director takes his turn in the hot seat. Go inside the drama of making a comedy, from executive producers Ben Affleck and Matt Damon.

entries.title: Rome
entries.synopsis: Generals and soldiers, masters and slaves, and husbands and wives all find themselves players in this epic series about the death of the republic, and birth of the most powerful empire in history.

entries.title: Show Me A Hero
entries.synopsis: A six-part miniseries from the creator of The Wire and the director of Crash depicts the true story of a young mayor (Oscar Isaac) whose attempt to fulfill a federal court order to build low-income housing in white neighborhoods tears his city apart.

entries.title: Silicon Valley
entries.synopsis: Watch HBO's hit show, Silicon Valley online or on air Sundays at 10pm. Catch up on full episodes, character bios and more for HBO's original comedy series about a computer programmer with a game-changing algorithm.

entries.title: Six Feet Under
entries.synopsis: When death is your business, what is your life? From Oscar-winner Alan Ball comes this darkly comic series about a dysfunctional L.A. family running a funeral business.

entries.title: Summer Heights High
entries.synopsis: Chris Lilley stars as Mr. G, Ja'mie King and Jonah Takalua in this outrageous, mockumentary-style comedy series that takes place over the course of one semester at the titular high school.

entries.title: The Leftovers
entries.synopsis: After 2 percent of the world's population inexplicably vanishes, those left behind grapple with what's next. Based on the bestselling novel by Tom Perrotta and co-created by Damon Lindelof (Lost).

entries.title: The Newsroom
entries.synopsis: Is it possible to produce good TV news and still make it popular? That's the question facing volatile cable-news anchor Will McAvoy (Jeff Daniels) and his idealogical staff in this drama from Aaron Sorkin.

entries.title: The Night Of
entries.synopsis: Created by Steven Zaillian (Schindler’s List) and Richard Price (The Wire), this limited series tracks a young man whose perfect night out becomes a nightmare when he’s arrested for murder.

entries.title: The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency
entries.synopsis: Jill Scott stars as a young woman from Botswana who fulfills a lifelong dream by opening her country's first female-owned detective agency, in this series based on the best-selling novels by Alexander McCall Smith.

entries.title: The Pacific
entries.synopsis: From the producers of Band of Brothers comes this epic 10-part miniseries that tells the true stories of three Marines battling in the Pacific theater during WWII.

entries.title: The Sopranos
entries.synopsis: Hailed as one of TV’s essential dramas, The Sopranos follows James Gandolfini as Tony Soprano, a husband, father and mob boss whose professional and private strains often land him in the office of his therapist.

entries.title: The Young Pope
entries.synopsis: Jude Law and Diane Keaton star in this limited series about a young, American pope who takes the Catholic church in a radical direction.

entries.title: Togetherness
entries.synopsis: Some people have it all figured out — these are not those people. This unique comedy series from Jay and Mark Duplass follows four adults nearing 40 as they search for meaning in their lives and relationships.

entries.title: Tracey Ullman's Show
entries.synopsis: Emmy-winning comedy legend Tracey Ullman portrays a dizzying array of everyday characters and famous faces who pop up in modern life on the British side of the pond.

entries.title: Treme
entries.synopsis: From David Simon and George Pelecanos (The Wire), comes Treme, set in New Orleans post-Hurricane Katrina. A group of residents strive to rebuild their lives without losing sight of the music and cultural traditions that make them, and the city, so unique.

entries.title: True Blood
entries.synopsis: In a time when vampires have entered the mainstream, a young Louisiana waitress (Anna Paquin) sets out to prove not only can vamps and humans co-exist, they can find true love. Created by Alan Ball (Six Feet Under) and based on the best-selling "Sookie Stackhouse" novels by Charlaine Harris.

entries.title: True Detective
entries.synopsis: Touch darkness and darkness touches you back. Created by Nic Pizzolatto, this gritty anthology crime series follows a different group of detectives every season, as they uncover sinister findings behind gruesome murders.

entries.title: Veep
entries.synopsis: Former senator Selina Meyer (Julia Louis-Dreyfus) finds that being Vice President of the United States is nothing like she hoped — and everything everyone warned her about.

entries.title: VICE
entries.synopsis: The taboo-breaking team from VICE deliver incredible news stories from around the world in this HBO series.

entries.title: Vinyl
entries.synopsis: In 1970s New York, a jaded record exec (Bobby Cannavale) tries to resurrect his failing label and fractured personal life while keeping his finger on the pulse of the city's new sound. Martin Scorsese, Mick Jagger, Terence Winter and Rich Cohen produce.

entries.title: Westworld
entries.synopsis: Live without limits in a world where every human appetite can be indulged. Starring Evan Rachel Wood, Anthony Hopkins, Jeffrey Wright, James Marsden, Thandie Newton, Ed Harris and more — this dark odyssey follows the dawn of artificial consciousness and the evolution of sin. Watch new episodes Sundays at 9 pm.

entries.title: Angry Boys
entries.synopsis: Australian comedian-actor-writer Chris Lilley (Summer Heights High, We Can Be Heroes) amps up his acutely observed, character-based comedy style with this mockumentary take on today's disenfranchised youth.

entries.title: Animals.
entries.synopsis: Explore unexpected tales of urban life as seen through the eyes of lovelorn rats, gender-questioning pigeons, and other downtrodden creatures in New York City. Executive produced by Jay and Mark Duplass (Togetherness) and created by Phil Matarese and Mike Luciano.

entries.title: Band of Brothers
entries.synopsis: This landmark miniseries based on Stephen E. Ambrose's best-seller, and executive produced by Steven Spielberg and Tom Hanks, recounts the remarkable achievements of an elite team of U.S. paratroopers during World War II.

entries.title: Carnivale
entries.synopsis: In a time of sandstorms, plagues, drought and pestilence, the final conflict between good and evil is about to begin. Set in the American Dustbowl in 1934, this cult series focuses on the battle as it plays out against a pair of unusual backdrops: a traveling carnival and an evangelical ministry in California.

entries.title: Doll & Em
entries.synopsis: Real-life best friends Emily Mortimer (The Newsroom) and Dolly Wells (Some Girls) portray fictionalized versions of themselves in this comedy series about an actress, Em, who hires her downcast pal, Doll, to be her assistant.

entries.title: Five Days
entries.synopsis: A mother and her two children vanish into thin air. As police search for clues, a mourning family learns nobody is quite what they seem.

entries.title: Flight of the Conchords
entries.synopsis: Jemaine Clement and Bret McKenzie, New Zealand’s 4th Most Popular Parody Duo, move to New York City to conquer America in this musical-comedy series about life, love and the pursuit of the elusive music video.

entries.title: Foo Fighters: Sonic Highways
entries.synopsis: Dave Grohl and the Foo Fighters set out on an eight-city road trip to explore and reconnect with America's musical identity — while creating the band's eighth album in the process.

entries.title: Funny or Die Presents
entries.synopsis: A sketch series that places the depraved sensibilities of today's funniest, most twisted comedic minds front-and-center — fusing scripted pieces with animated vignettes, music videos, faux commercials and beyond.

entries.title: Girls
entries.synopsis: Lena Dunham’s fearless comedy tackles female friendship through the eyes of four 20-somethings as they attempt to navigate the unpredictable waters of adulthood in New York.

entries.title: High Maintenance
entries.synopsis: Based on the web series from Katja Blichfeld and Ben Sinclair, High Maintenance stars Sinclair as "The Guy," a bike-riding, weed-delivery salesman with an eclectic variety of Brooklyn clients.

entries.title: Ja'mie: Private School Girl
entries.synopsis: Ja'mie King, Summer Heights High's notorious "queen bee" is back in this six-part comedy created by and starring Chris Lilley.

entries.title: John From Cincinnati
entries.synopsis: The surfing talents of the Yost family have always seemed to come with a curse attached — until a stranger arrives and their banal existence is lifted into something profound, miraculous and, possibly, universal.

entries.title: Mr. Show
entries.synopsis: Bob Odenkirk and David Cross are Bob, David and dozens of other loosely-connected characters in this iconic series that blends sketch comedy with absurdist insight.

entries.title: Real Sports with Bryant Gumbel
entries.synopsis: Real Sports is TV's most-honored sports journalism series, with a record 31 Sports Emmy Awards, including 18 for Outstanding Sports Journalism. Now in its 23rd season, the monthly magazine TV show produces unchartered investigative pieces and in-depth profiles from across the sports spectrum.

entries.title: Real Time with Bill Maher
entries.synopsis: He's irrepressible, opinionated, and of course, politically incorrect. Comedian and satirist Bill Maher hosts this long-running, Emmy-nominated talk show, covering the week’s news and featuring a panel of guests, including actors, activists, politicians, musicians, comedians and more.

entries.title: Room 104
entries.synopsis: Every guest has a story. From the Duplass Brothers (Togetherness, Animals) comes an anthology series about 12 guests, one room and infinite possibilities.

entries.title: Sex and the City
entries.synopsis: How do single women and men find mates in New York? Sarah Jessica Parker stars as 30-something writer Carrie Bradshaw, whose personal life and friendships are fodder for her weekly column.

entries.title: Tell Me You Love Me
entries.synopsis: Sex. Intimacy. Marriage. Life. This provocative drama series explores issues of intimacy within the lives of three couples and the therapist they share.

entries.title: The Casual Vacancy
entries.synopsis: Based on the best-selling book by J.K. Rowling, this three-part drama series chronicles a town torn apart when an anonymous blogger begins revealing ugly local secrets.

entries.title: The Deuce
entries.synopsis: Created by George Pelecanos and David Simon (The Wire) and starring James Franco and Maggie Gyllenhaal, The Deuce explores 1970s New York at the beginning of what would become the billion-dollar American sex industry.

entries.title: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst
entries.synopsis: Filmmaker Andrew Jarecki examines the complicated life of Robert Durst, a man at the heart of three murders spanning four decades.

entries.title: The Wire
entries.synopsis: In the drug-ridden streets of West Baltimore, there are good guys and there are bad guys. Sometimes you need more than a badge to tell them apart. From creator David Simon, this is The Wire.

entries.title: Todd McFarlane’s Spawn
entries.synopsis: A man makes a deal with the devil to return to earth in search of revenge, and the woman he loves. This cult favorite is based on the comic book series from Todd Mcfarlane.

entries.title: Dennis Miller Live
entries.synopsis: Dennis Miller hosts this classic comedy series in which he presents his insightful, irreverent takes on the world's newsmakers and breakers.

entries.title: The Larry Sanders Show
entries.synopsis: Garry Shandling is Larry Sanders in this iconic showbiz comedy about a fictional late night talk show host and his dysfunctional staff.

entries.title: Angels in America
entries.synopsis: Directed by Mike Nichols and written by Pulitzer-winning playwright Tony Kushner, this Emmy-winning four-part film, starring Emma Thompson, Meryl Streep, Al Pacino and more, chronicles the stories behind AIDS diagnoses in New York City.

entries.title: Vice Principals
entries.synopsis: Danny McBride (Eastbound & Down) and Walton Goggins star as rival high school administrators who forge an unholy alliance to take down their new, frustratingly competent, principal.

entries.title: UConn: The March to Madness
entries.synopsis: This unscripted series chronicles the 2016-17 season of the University of Connecticut women's basketball team.

entries.title: Hard Knocks
entries.synopsis: New team. New stars. New season. Follow the Tampa Bay Buccaneers during the toughest five weeks of their lives.

entries.title: Dane Cook's Tourgasm
entries.synopsis: Follow stand-up star Dane Cook and fellow comedians Jay Davis, Robert Kelly and Gary Gulman on their 20-show Tourgasm tour.

entries.title: Garfunkel and Oates
entries.synopsis: Garfunkel and Oates stars Riki Lindhome (Enlightened) and Kate Micucci (Raising Hope) as both themselves and their musical comedy alter-egos, "Garfunkel and Oates," following the pair as they try to expand the reaches of their meager celebrity.

entries.title: Russell Simmons Presents Brave New Voices
entries.synopsis: Six teams of teenage poets compete in verbal battle in an effort to make it to Washington, D.C. for the National Slam Poetry championship.

entries.title: Russell Simmons Presents Def Comedy
entries.synopsis: ​From executive producer Russell Simmons, comes this series of stand-up specials featuring today's boldest comics.

entries.title: HBO Comedy Half-Hour
entries.synopsis: The hottest comedy talents of the 1990s headline these solo half-hour stand-up specials.

entries.title: Down and Dirty with Jim Norton
entries.synopsis: Stand-up superstar Jim Norton welcomes the country's hottest comics to perform their most outrageous routines in this comedy series.

entries.title: One-Night Stand
entries.synopsis: Up-and-coming (and many now-famous) comedy talents from around the country perform their uncensored routines in front of a live audience.

entries.title: Alice
entries.synopsis: A young woman discovers a new world of friends, love and experience when she travels to Sao Paulo for her father's funeral in this series.

entries.title: Capadocia
entries.synopsis: In a Mexico City women's prison, attorney Teresa Lagos fights for inmate's rights and against corruption in this drama series.

entries.title: Chumel con Chumel Torres
entries.synopsis: From Twitter to HBO comes this weekly program of opinion, analysis and black humor with host Chumel Torres.

entries.title: Destino Deporte
entries.synopsis: Explore the world of sports from the furthest regions of Latin America in this international series that focuses on athletes, the issues affecting sports, and more.

entries.title: Dios Inc.
entries.synopsis: A great discovery that could change the world--the origin of God--unleashes a battle for power in this series.

entries.title: El Hipnotizador
entries.synopsis: A talented hypnotist suffers from insomnia that hides a dark secret in this compelling HBO Latino series.

entries.title: El Jardin de Bronce
entries.synopsis: When a couple's young child disappears without a trace, a desperate search begins, changing their lives forever, in this HBO Latino series.

entries.title: El Negocio
entries.synopsis: Three attractive, intelligent women come together with the common goal of revolutionizing the world's oldest profession in this series.

entries.title: Epitafios
entries.synopsis: A former cop and his psychiatrist ex-lover must team up in the hunt for a serial killer who is linked to their past in this series.

entries.title: Fantasmagorias
entries.synopsis: Latin America's most hair-raising supernatural legends are brought to life in this collection of eight animated short films.

entries.title: Gran'pa Knows Best
entries.synopsis: A comedy web-series whose star is a 4-inch 3D-printed likeness of creator William D. Caballero's grandfather.

entries.title: Heroes Cotidianos
entries.synopsis: This deeply moving series chronicles the stories of ordinary people doing extraordinary things.

entries.title: Hijos del Carnaval
entries.synopsis: Anesio Gebara owns a Rio samba school and bankrolls an illegal lottery in this series that follows his life and his family.

entries.title: Magnifica 70
entries.synopsis: Set in Sao Paulo in the 1970s, this series follows 35-year-old Vicente, a young government film censor whose fascination with a risque movie — and its lead actress — takes him out of his safe middle-class life and into the city's red-light district.

entries.title: Mandrake
entries.synopsis: Meet Paulo Mandrake, a charismatic defense attorney who finds himself sidetracked by his vices — especially beautiful Brazilian women — while serving as a liaison between his high-end clients and the Rio de Janeiro subculture. Marcos Palmeira stars in this HBO Latino drama series.

entries.title: Mujer de Fases
entries.synopsis: Grace is a 30-something divorcee. But finding a mate isn't an easy task. And unlike the fairy tale, the prince often turns into a frog — not the other way around. This comedy series follows Grace (Elisa Volpatto) as she juggles potential love interests with the support of her overprotective mother Hilda, her best friend Selma, and Selma's pre-teen daughter Tereza.

entries.title: Profugos
entries.synopsis: Four men land in a tangled web of ambition and corruption after a drug-trafficking operation goes awry in this HBO Latino series.

entries.title: Psi
entries.synopsis: Carlo Antonini is a psychiatrist, psychologist and psychoanalyst interested in unusual cases in this HBO Latino series.

entries.title: Sr. Avila
entries.synopsis: A middle-class family man hides a secret life as the head of an organization of contract killers in this drama series.

entries.title: The Fight Game with Jim Lampley
entries.synopsis: Segments: a look back at Canelo vs. Golovkin; Rungvisai's big KO over 'Chocolatito'; a farewell to recently retired boxers; Pat Manuel.

entries.title: Wyatt Cenac's Problem Areas
entries.synopsis: Acclaimed comedian/writer Wyatt Cenac hosts a new comedy docu-series that examines America s most pressing, hot-button issues.

entries.title: Halfworlds
entries.synopsis: Delve into the underworld of mythological demons that inhabit the back alleys of Jakarta in this series.

entries.title: The Pact
entries.synopsis: An investigative journalist stumbles into a twisted web of death and deceit when he looks into a series of suicides.

entries.title: Wasteland
entries.synopsis: Set in a small Czech village, this series follows a local mayor whose daughter disappears amid a battle with a powerful coal company.

entries.title: La Vida Secreta de las Parejas
entries.synopsis: A sexologist hides her own psychological issues in this suspenseful drama series set in Sao Paulo, Brazil.

entries.title: Sharp Objects
entries.synopsis: Based on the book by Gillian Flynn (Gone Girl), reporter Camille Preaker (Amy Adams) returns to her hometown to investigate the murders of two young girls. The upcoming HBO series is directed by Jean-Marc Vallée (Big Little Lies) with scripts from Marti Noxon and Flynn.

entries.title: Mosaic
entries.synopsis: A six-part thriller about a children's author (Sharon Stone) who gets submerged in a twisting tale of passion, intrigue and deception.

entries.title: Here and Now
entries.synopsis: A contemporary multiracial family faces a series of life changes and emotional challenges in this HBO series.

entries.title: Succession
entries.synopsis: When a media tycoon considers retirement, each of his four grown children begins angling for their piece of the pie in this series.
